Hi Friends üëã,

Welcome To aGuideHub!

To change height of mui avatar in React js, you can use this style style={{ height: "80px", width: "80px" }}. It will change height of mui avatar in react js.

Today, I am going to show you, how to change height of mui avatar in react js.

Installation

Install the following packages to use mui avatar in react js.

npm

npm install @mui/material @emotion/react @emotion/styled

yarn

yarn add @mui/material @emotion/react @emotion/styled

Table of contents

  • Install MUI and create a new React app.
  • Import the Avatar component from MUI.
  • Use the Avatar component in your JS code.
  • Add inline styles to adjust the height.

Step 1: Install MUI and create a new React app.

First you have to install the React project. You should use create-react-app command to create a new React project.

npx create-react-app my-app
cd my-app
npm start

Step 2: Import the Avatar component from MUI.

Once you have your app set up, you can start working with the Avatar component from MUI. To do this, you will need to import the Avatar component in your component file:

import Avatar from "@mui/material/Avatar"

Step 3: Use the Avatar component in your JS code.

You can use the Avatar component in your react js. For example, you can have the following code to display an avatar with an image.

<Avatar  alt="User Name" src="/static/images/avatar/1.jpg" />

Step 4: Add inline styles to adjust the height.

You can add inline styles to the Avatar component. For example, you can add the following style to set the height to 80 pixels and the width to 80 pixels.

<Avatar alt="User Name" src="/static/images/avatar/1.jpg"
style={{ height: "80px", width: "80px" }} />

MUI material change height of mui avatar example.

The below code is an example of changing height of mui avatar using.

App.js

import Avatar from "@mui/material/Avatar";

export default function App() {
  return (
    <div>
      <Avatar
        alt="User Name"
        src="/static/images/avatar/1.jpg"
        style={{ height: "80px", width: "80px" }} // specify the height and width in pixels
      />
    </div>
  );
}

In the above code example, I have used the @mui/material component and changed height of mui avatar in react js.
